page.title: 17History in our Block
page.content: the farmers desire to use the field in which they were discovered. Little remains of the Middle Ages in our block. During the mid 19th Century,Uley became an important woollen centre. It was during these times that the school and the village hall were built. The biggest mill belonged to a family called the Sheppards. However,the collapse of the woollen industry brought dreadful unemployment and poverty which drove quite a few families to emigrate to America and Australia. The present day descendants of these people are currently being traced by the school. The collapse of the woollen industry gradually returned the village to a sleepy rural place with just a few cottage industries and residential houses.
